sensorRead.helper: How often sensors are read (1000-60000 ms)

license.noActiveDescription: Please activate a license to unlock all features

featureGate.userCta: This feature isn't enabled on your organization's license. Contact your administrator if you need access.

license.keyHint: Paste the license key you received after purchase.

blocker.title: License Required
blocker.requiresActivation: Activate your license to continue using the platform.
blocker.expired: Your license has expired. Please renew to regain access.
blocker.adminMessage: Enter a valid license key below to restore access for all users.
blocker.userMessage: Access is temporarily limited until an administrator renews the license.
blocker.noLicense: No active license is currently configured.
blocker.contactAdmin: Please contact your administrator to reactivate the platform.

environment.title: Environment Variables
environment.emptyDescription1: The .env file doesn't exist or is empty. Environment variables are used to configure your application settings like database connections, API keys, and other sensitive configurations.
environment.emptyDescription2: You can create environment variables below, and they will be saved to your .env file automatically.
environment.hint: Press Tab to format variable names, or Enter to add the variable
environment.restartNotice: Changes may require server restart to take effect
environment.saveSuccess: {{restartRequired, select, true{Environment variables updated successfully. Server restart required.} false{Environment variables updated successfully.}}}

availability.title: Platform Update
availability.behindBy: {{count}} new commit{{count, plural, one{} other{s}}} available
availability.warning1: The update process will restart the entire system
availability.warning2: All users will be disconnected temporarily
availability.warning3: The process may take several minutes to complete
availability.warning4: Make sure no critical operations are running

upToDate.title: System is up to date
upToDate.synchronized: Your platform is synchronized with the remote repository.
upToDate.instruction2: Make it executable and place it in your system PATH

messages.started: Platform update started! Monitor progress below.
messages.scriptMissing: Update script is not available on this system
messages.confirm: Are you sure you want to update the platform? This will restart the system and may take several minutes. Make sure no critical operations are running.

database.title: Database Management
database.backupDescription: Download a complete backup of your database including all devices, users, alerts, and telemetry data.

email.title: Email Configuration
email.notice: Email settings are configured in the backend environment file (.env). Restart the application after making changes.

serialMonitor.title: Serial Monitor
serialMonitor.description: Monitor serial output from your ESP8266/ESP32 devices in real-time

log.portBusy: Port is busy, please disconnect and reconnect device
log.empty: Connect a device and start monitoring to see output

serialMonitor.step1: Connect your ESP8266/ESP32 device via USB
serialMonitor.step2: Click "Connect Device" and select the serial port
serialMonitor.step3: Select the appropriate baud rate (usually 115200 for ESP devices)
serialMonitor.step5: View real-time serial output from your device
serialMonitor.step6: Use "Download" to save the log to a file

instructions.title: Before Flashing:
instructions.step1: Connect your device to your computer via USB
instructions.step2: Install the CP210x or CH340 USB driver if needed
instructions.step3: Hold the FLASH button while clicking "Connect Device"
instructions.step4: Release the FLASH button after connection is established

unsupported.title: Browser Not Supported
unsupported.description: Web-based flashing requires a browser that supports the WebSerial API.

steps.browser: Use Chrome 89+ or Edge 89+ (You appear to be using Chrome {{version}})
steps.secure: Access the site via HTTPS or localhost
steps.flags: Enable "Experimental Web Platform features" in chrome://flags
steps.restart: Restart your browser after enabling the flag

log.apiDetected: Web Serial API detected - web flashing available
log.apiUnavailable: Web Serial API not available. Chrome: {{isChrome}}, Version: {{version}}
log.requiresSecureContext: Web Serial API requires HTTPS or localhost
log.portBusyRelease: Serial port busy, attempting to release previous connection...
log.readyCheckSuccess: Serial port responded to readiness check
log.registrationSkipped: Skipping device registration: device ID missing from configuration
log.registrationExists: Device already exists in platform; skipping registration
log.unsupportedPlatform: Web flashing is not yet available for {{platform}}.
log.useDownloadOption: Use the download option and flash the binary with a platform-appropriate tool.
log.fallbackBaud: Connection taking longer than expected. Switching to fallback baud rate {{baud}}.
log.connectionRetry: Connection attempt {{attempt}} failed ({{message}}). Retrying in {{delay}} ms... ({{remaining}} retries left)
log.fallbackBaudSuccess: Connection established using fallback baud rate {{baud}}.
log.postFlashOnline: Device should connect to WiFi and appear online shortly
log.postFlashMonitor: Click "Start Serial Monitor" to view device output
log.disconnectWarning: Warning: failed to release serial port cleanly ({{message}})
log.monitorStarted: Serial monitor started - Listening for device output...

errors.maxRetries: Unable to gain access to the serial port after multiple retries. Last error: {{message}}

deviceLocations.subtitle: Manage physical locations where your devices are deployed
deviceLocations.selectGroup: Choose a group from the left to view and manage its devices.
